content.description: This is a very striking boulder problem. Begin matched on an undercling at 5 feet, and move into an awesome layback seam feature with awkward feet but good hands. Exit the crack at the lip using bad but cool slopers ending in a committing finale at a huge jug. Pull a slightly scary and technical mantel to get standing on the ramp, and either free-solo over and down a crack (easy terrain) or clip into a rope and lower (also easy). ABI is a classic line with a good landing as well as a short approach and is sure to become a classic for those looking for a sick problem with a tad bit of spice.
content.protection: 3 pads and a spot. There is a good, slanted landing.
content.location:
It is the leftmost climb on New Economy Wall and is left of

On Line Trading

by about 15 feet. The corner is not on for feet as it’s essentially another boulder. It doesn’t affect it either way though.
